column4: I've had a problem with intermittent extra mouse clicks (moving a window maximize instead) (problem selecting text) since updating to 2.6.31-20-generic last week.  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1429091&highlight=click+drag+broken describes it well.  Anyone else seen this?  have a fix?
i want to run sudo commands, but it doesnt work..
your SOL on that one.  Run them in root's cron if you can.
you can make sure sudo doesn't prompt for a password etc and may get somewhere with it.
why would it ask password if i run it with sudo?
sudo prompts for password to verify the user's identity matches up in the sudoers file for that command.
so i have to login to root..thats the only way?
you can turn that off by adding   Somthing like "Defaults:ALL            !authenticate"  to your sudoers file.
as these are cron jobs you want to run as root, put them in root's crontab.  If that's not what you want.  Please clarify.
okay, i'l try to mess with that
yeah, i want roots jobs to run from my account
I don't see why you would want to do that.  You want them to be in your cron jobs but run as root.  Is this a desktop or a shared server?
its a desktop. i want to shutdown my system while i'm still in my account. and halt needs root
cron jobs run for the user whether they are logged in or not.  root's cron jobs will run as scheduled no matter who is logged in.
